articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The U.N. is due to start vaccinating some 640,000 children in the territory.
articles.title: Israeli bombardment kills dozens in Gaza as health officials prepare polio campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five people were killed and 46 injured in a Ukrainian attack on the southwestern Russian city of Belgorod late on Friday, the local governor said, the latest in a series of strikes by Ukraine on the city in recent months.
articles.title: Russia says five killed, 46 injured in Ukraine strike on Belgorod

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least six people were dead as Typhoon Shanshan crept eastward through Japan on Saturday, drenching large areas with torrential rain, triggering landslide and flood warnings hundreds of kilometres from the storm's centre.
articles.title: At least 6 dead in Japan as Typhoon Shanshan grinds on

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Matthew Griffiths told investigators the crew did everything they could.
articles.title: Crew member on Mike Lynch yacht tells of being thrown into water

articles.author: Gerauds Wilfried Obangome
articles.description: A year since a military coup in Gabon ended the Bongo dynasty's 56-year rule, the country marked the anniversary in festive mood this week with celebrations and promises by the ruling junta to step up progress on reforms.
articles.title: Gabon marks year since 'coup of liberation' with celebrations, reform pledges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Norway's Princess Martha Louise married her long-term partner, American spiritual guru Durek Verrett, on Saturday in a ceremony attended by the Norwegian king and other royalty but marked by what critics saw as commercialisation of the event.
articles.title: Norway's Princess Martha Louise weds US spiritual guru

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Burkina Faso massacre survivor describes bloodshed in trenches

articles.author: Neil Morales, Joe Cash
articles.description: The Philippines and China exchanged accusations of intentionally ramming coast guard vessels in disputed waters of the South China Sea on Saturday, the latest in an escalating series of clashes in the vital waterway.
articles.title: China, Philippines accuse each other of ramming ships in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Serbia's President Aleksandar Vucic said on Saturday his country was unlikely to enter the European Union in 2028, a date targeted by some other western Balkan countries hoping to join the bloc.
articles.title: Serbia unlikely to join EU before end of decade, says President Vucic

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israel's military searched areas around settlements in the occupied West Bank on Saturday after two separate security incidents the previous evening, as a major army and police operation continued in the flashpoint city of Jenin.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill two attackers, military says, in continued West Bank violence
